title: Penelope's Experiences in Scotland; Being Extracts from the Commonplace Book of Penelope Hamilton
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith
snippet: The earl took the greatest interest in my new ancestors, and approved thoroughly of my choice. He thinks I must have been named for Lady Penelope Belhaven, who lived in Leven Lodge, one of the country villas of the Earls of Leven, from whom he himself is descended. "Does that make us relatives?"

title: Penelope's progress :
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith
snippet: He thinks I must have been named for Lady- Penelope Belhaven, who lived in Leven Lodge, one of the country villas of the Earls of Leven, from whom he himself is descended. " Does that make us relatives ? " I asked.
